III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS & CONCLUSIONS
A. Physical Description of Facility
The Sanctuary is a short term and treatment facility in a residential area in Royal
Oak, MI. Upon entering through the front door is the lobby with seating and
pamphlet resources. Exiting the lobby area is the locked medication storage room
to the right. The next area is the dining room and multipurpose room with tables
and chairs in the middle of the room surrounded by six bedrooms. Bedrooms 1
and 2 can sleep three youths in each room. Bedrooms 3 and 4 can sleep one
youth in each room. Bedrooms 5 and 6 can sleep two youth in each room. Across
from bedrooms 5 and 6 are two full bathrooms and a half bathroom. Next to the
bathrooms is the laundry area with a utility sink. An art and crafts room with tables
and chairs and project materials is at the end of this area. Across from the locked
medication room is a full-service kitchen. The staff bathroom is attached to the
kitchen. Facing the staff bathroom to the left is a staircase that leads upstairs to
the administrative office, counseling office, art therapy office and a staff bathroom.
Facing the staff bathroom to the right is a staircase closed by a door that leads to
the basement, which is a storage area with an additional refrigerator and freezer.
Next to the kitchen is a recreation room with couches, coffee table, television, and
games. The staff office is next to the recreation room. The facility has an outdoor
area with seating and a grill.
B. Program Description
The Sanctuary is a 12-bed facility in Royal Oak, Michigan. It has 7 short term
shelter beds and 5 treatment beds.
The shelter program is a voluntary 21-day program for youths ages 10 to 16 years
old. Individual counseling, group work and family therapy are offered to assist in
resolving issues and providing support.
The treatment program is a voluntary maximum 18-month program for youths
ages 16 to 17 years old. Individual counseling, case management, and life skills
curriculum are provided to assist the youth in gaining independence, employment,
and a safe living environment.
C. Rule/Statutory Violations
The Sanctuary is in compliance.
